Commercial Contract Advice
At Becker Watt Lawyers, we have vast experience in reviewing, analysing and advising clients on most standard form building contracts. If required, we can draft amendments or special conditions to give you the protection you need to minimise the risks associated with commercial building projects. Our experienced team of building contract lawyers at Becker Watt ensure all contracts are fully compliant with the relevant legislation, including, but not limited to: 

Queensland Building and Construction Commission Act 1991;
Building Industry Fairness (Security of Payment) Act 2017; and
Personal Properties and Securities Act 2009 (Cth).
If you require further information, contact our building contract lawyers on 07 3269 4888 or info@beckerwatt.com.au.

Residential Contract Advice
No matter which stage you are at in your construction project, Becker Watt Lawyers can provide you with assistance every step of the way. Our team of experienced construction law solicitors can review the construction contract and offer plain English advice. Our Brisbane construction lawyers have vast experience in liaising with the QBCC, and challenging their decisions when and as necessary. We will ensure your contract is compliant with industry legislation and regulations.

Our team has in-depth knowledge and experience in all the industry standard forms of construction, including (but not limited to):

Master Builder Queensland (MBQ)
Housing Industry Association (HIA)
Queensland Building and Construction Commission (QBCC)
Australian Building Industry Contracts (ABIC)
If you require further information, contact our building contract lawyers on 07 3269 4888 or info@beckerwatt.com.au.

Residential Builders
Building a house, or any other type of construction and development project, is a large commitment that can cost a lot of money. To avoid any unpleasant building disputes down the road, it is critical that you invest some time and money at the start.

We can assist you with:

Contract review and compliance – we will make sure your subcontracts are compliant;
Negotiations and dispute resolution – we can help you resolve disputes; we have highly experienced building dispute lawyers, equipped to take on your legal battle.
Interactions with the QBCC – we can assist in your dealings with the QBCC including directions to rectify and other disciplinary actions like QBCC disputes; and
Debt recovery.
If you’re a residential builder and find yourself in the middle of an unavoidable dispute related to building and construction, one of your best solutions would be to seek the help of experienced legal professionals. Our legal advisors can offer our expertise in defending your rights through a legally proper method, thus making sure that all applicable criteria are met under the law. From negotiation and mediation strategies to dispute resolution strategies and handling litigation proceedings – Becker Watt Lawyers can efficiently help shoulder your burden as you work to move forward throughout your dispute resolution journey.

We understand Residential Builders. Our residential construction lawyers are well placed to assist you with any disoutes and all of your building and general business requirements.

Commercial Builders
We can assist you with:

Contract review – let us review your construction contract and provide you with legal advice;
Contract negotiations – let us help you negotiate a balanced contract;
Subcontractor selection and negotiation – let us help you with your contract administration. We are here to provide you with additional contract administration resources;
Payment Claims – we can draft your payment claims;
Payment Schedules – let us assist with the drafting of your payment schedules to ensure that you comply with the strict BIFA time frames;
Contract disputes – our construction dispute lawyers can help resolve contractual disputes that may arise and if necessary, see the matter through the litigation process
We can provide you with all the legal services you need; both front and back end.

Developers
It’s important to ensure that you engage your project lawyers early. We can assist you with all your project’s legal requirements.

Let us help you:

Select the right type of contract for your project – either design and construct or construct only. Our lawyers can give you legal advice on your construction contract
Negotiate a contract with your selected Contractor – we can ensure that your rights are protected during the course of construction and beyond
Client-side contract administration – we can help ensure that your contractor complies with all their obligations
Payment Schedules – let us help draft your payment schedules to ensure strict compliance with the requirements of the BIFA and its timeframes
Contract disputes – our construction dispute lawyers can help resolve contractual disputes that may arise and if necessary, see the matter through the litigation process

Our construction contract lawyers are highly skilled to provide legal services for your project.
BIFA
Building Industry Fairness (Security of Payment) Act 2017 (“BIFA”) has now become an integral part of getting paid for construction work in Queensland. One of the integral aspects of the BIFA is the very short timelines. In an environment where timelines are critical, we are construction lawyers with industry knowledge, who can give you the answers you need, when you need them.

We are focused on providing our clients with timely and cost-effective advice. Our experienced lawyers have represented clients in BIFA matters from a few thousand to a few million dollars.

We know the deadlines imposed on building industry participants for both BIFA claimants and respondents. We are equipped to ensure you meet these deadlines.

We are experienced in BIFA adjudication applications and responses. Our firm is capable of mobilizing a team on short notice to meet the often onerous time requirements of the BIFA.

In circumstances where you are unsatisfied with the result of a BIFA decision, we are able to advise you of your options in a commercial and expedient manner.

Another facet of our BIFA practice area is advising clients with regards to the best practices in issuing and dealing with BIFA claims. We can advise on appropriate drafting for BIFA claims and invoices, incorporating terms in contracts and subcontracts consistent with BIFA legislation, and provide advice on how best to respond to a BIFA claim.

To discuss your legal matter with a highly experienced construction lawyer in Brisbane please call 07 3269 4888, or email us.

If you’d like to learn more about us and construction law, our videos can give you comprehensive insight.}

This content would be helpful to a homeowner who is planning to build, renovate or extend their home. The homeowner can get legal assistance from Becker Watt Lawyers in reviewing and advising on residential building contracts, negotiating with builders and resolving disputes, among others. This would ensure that the homeowner is fully protected throughout the construction process and that all contracts are compliant with industry legislation and regulations. Additionally, the homeowner can get legal assistance in complying with the Building Industry Fairness (Security of Payment) Act 2017, which is an integral part of getting paid for construction work in Queensland.
